newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel, U.S. to discuss Israeli economic reforms.
newsitem.headline: Israel, U.S. to discuss Israeli economic reforms.

text.p: The Joint Economic Development Group of Israeli and U.S. government officials will hold its semi-annual meeting in Jerusalem on Sunday, Israel's Treasury said.
The group was formed in 1985 to monitor economic reforms in Israel.

The head of the Israeli delegation will be David Brodett, director-general of Israel's Finance Ministry. The head of the U.S. delegation will be Undersecretary of State for Economic Affairs Joan Spero.
The Treasury said that at the end of the meeting a discussion would be held to exchange views on privatisation and competitiveness.
Among participants will be Joseph Stiglitz, head of the White House Council of Economic Advisers, other government officials, academics and private-sector economists.
